column34: Cloud is expensive. Cloud based tools for analysis (datalad) are cludgy and its hard to inspire people to adopt when its not a finished product. Each insitution also has its "in-house" rules and methods, making data sharing always a new problem. My dataset also precedes BIDS so tools and software for sharing and analyzing don't work

column34: the main barrier is national regulations (the US are more liberal than us in the EU/CH) and PIs not wanting to just provide data to the public domain for fears of others publishing on our same topics using our data. I am junior faculty so I have no hand in this, it is therefore hard to influence policies at senior faculty level.
